# Q004 Chemical Symbols
^question Q004
^type text_entry
^identifier TE_Q001
^title Chemical Symbols
^points 2
^labels #Chemistry #Elements #Apply #Medium

@field: question_text
Enter the chemical symbol for the following elements:

Water is made of hydrogen and {{blank_1}}.
The symbol for gold is {{blank_2}}.
@end_field

@field: blanks

@@field: blank_1
^Correct_Answers
- oxygen
- Oxygen
- O
^Case_Sensitive No
@@end_field

@@field: blank_2
^Correct_Answers
- Au
- AU
- au
^Case_Sensitive No
@@end_field

@end_field

@field: scoring
^Points_per_correct_field 1
^Points_minimum 0
@end_field

@field: feedback

@@field: general_feedback
Water (H2O) contains hydrogen and oxygen. Gold's symbol Au comes from Latin "aurum".
@@end_field

@@field: correct_feedback
Correct! Oxygen and Au.
@@end_field

@@field: incorrect_feedback
Incorrect. Review chemical symbols.
@@end_field

@@field: partial_feedback
Partially correct.
@@end_field

@@field: unanswered_feedback
Please fill in all blanks.
@@end_field

@end_field
